record.title: AMENDING THE IMMIGRATION AND NATIONALITY ACT
record.narrative:
AMENDING THE IMMIGRATION AND NATIONALITY ACT -- (Senate - September 26, 2008)

[Page: S9606]

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the Senate proceed to the immediate consideration of Calendar No. 960, S. 3166.

record.chair: The clerk will report the bill by title.
record.narrative: The legislative clerk read as follows:

A bill (S. 3166) to amend the Immigration and Nationality Act to impose criminal penalties on individuals who assist aliens who have engaged in genocide, torture, or extrajudicial killings to enter the United States.
There being no objection, the Senate proceeded to consider the bill.

speaking.paragraph: Mr. President, I ask unanimous consent that the bill be read a third time and passed, the motion to reconsider be laid upon the table, and that any statements relating to the bill be printed in the Record.

record.chair: Without objection, it is so ordered.
The bill (S. 3166) was ordered to be engrossed for a third reading, was read the third time, and passed, as follows:

Be it enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the United States of America in Congress assembled,

   SECTION 1. AIDING OR ASSISTING CERTAIN ALIENS TO ENTER THE UNITED STATES.

Section 277 of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1327) is amended by striking "(other than subparagraph (E) thereof)".

END
